availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
James F Robinson
Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky
To All who shall see these presents greeting
Whereas, Judgment has been rendered by the Grayson Circuit Court. for $500. against the sureties of Joseph Tucker upon a forfeiture recognizance
And Whereas, It appears from satisfactory evidence that the case of the said securities presents strong considerations for the interposition and indulgence of the Executive,

Now, Know Ye, that in consideration of the premises, and by virtue of the power vested in me by the Constitution, I have thought proper to Remit and do, by these presents, remit said Judgment save fees & costs
And do forever acquit, release, and discharge the said Securities from the same enjoining all officers to respect this Remission, and govern themselves accordingly.

In Testimony Whereof, I have caused these letters to be made patent, and the seal of the Commonwealth to be hereunto affixed, Done at Frankfort, the 29th day of Aug. in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and 62, and in the 71st year of the Commonwealth

By the Governor J. F Robinson
D. C. Wickliffe Secretary of State
By Jas W. Tate Asst Secy

Grayson Cir. Ct
$500 } Recog.
Sureties of Jos Tucker
Judgment for $5 to be remitted after 12 May
Remission Isd
May 13. 1863.
